ovdesc.p: PP.STATUS.ACTION table stores the action (program) to be executed, per company, for status codes of the payment.

desc.p: Indicates the company ID for which the record is created.
The value links to the field CompanyID of PPT.COMPANY table.
Indicates the status for which notification must be sent to the monitoring system as defined in PPT.STATUSCODE.
Defines a program name to link a certain program to a specific status.
The value links to the field ProgramName of PPT.PROGRAMCHARACTERISTIC table.
Specifies status description to be sent to the monitoring system in case of non succesful event.
Mandatory input field if StatusRouterExpectedErrorCode is filled.
Specifies the error code expected by the monitoring system in case of non-successful event.
Specifies the status code expected by the monitoring system. Expected Status is Integer, possible values are any negative integer and 1.
0 and values greater than 1 and special characters are not allowed to input.
Indicates the date from which the record is active. Defaulted to select companyâ€™s current business date when Validate or Submit button is clicked and the user has not inputted a value.
The start date must be greater or equal with the current business date
Indicates the date till which the record is active.
End Date must be greater than or Equal to Start Date.
Record Activation Code generated for the record by the payment's hub.
H-YYYYMMDDHHMMSSsss - History. Where: YYYY - year, MM - month, DD - day, HH - hour, MM - minutes, SS - seconds and sss - miliseconds.
The value is not editable by the user.
Record Status Code generated for the record by the payments hub.
The value is not editable by the user.
Used for internal purpose. Value of this field determines values of fields, 'RAC' and 'RSC'
This field can hold upto 1 alphanumeric character and the value is not editable by the user.
Used for internal purpose.Holds the ID of the current live record of store table.
This field can hold upto 65 alphanumeric characters and the value is not editable by the user.
Used for internal purpose. Holds the ID of the previous live record of store table.
This field can hold upto 65 alphanumeric characters and the value is not editable by the user.

Contains all the override messages which the user agreed to during Input. During the validation of a transaction, the system may provide the user with a series of screen override messages to indicate an anomaly.
Specifies the source through which the payment hub receives a message.
